security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation-based skill containing only markdown prompts and instructions. No executable code, scripts, or direct file/network access capabilities exist. The skill merely describes how to delegate browser tasks to the chrome-devtools-expert agent.

content.user_title: Automate browser tasks with smart delegation
content.value_statement: Browser automation can quickly consume tokens and pollute conversation context with page snapshots and network data. This skill delegates all browser operations to a specialized Chrome DevTools agent, keeping your main conversation clean and token-efficient.
actual_capabilities: Delegates browser tasks to specialized chrome-devtools-expert agent
Handles page navigation and multi-tab management
Performs element interactions including clicks, hovers, and drag-and-drop
Captures screenshots and page snapshots on demand
Executes automated testing and form submission workflows
Conducts performance analysis with Core Web Vitals metrics
limitations: Requires Chrome DevTools MCP server to be configured and running
Cannot execute browser actions without the chrome-devtools-expert agent
Network and device simulation depend on MCP tool capabilities
Data extraction is limited to JavaScript-executable page content

use_cases.title: Automated UI Testing
use_cases.description: Test form submissions, button clicks, and user flows without manual browser interaction

use_cases.title: Performance Analysis
use_cases.description: Measure page load times and Core Web Vitals under various network conditions

use_cases.title: Web Data Extraction
use_cases.description: Extract product listings, pricing data, or structured content from web pages

prompt_templates.title: Open and Capture
prompt_templates.scenario: Visit a URL and take a screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Open {url} and take a full-page screenshot when loaded

prompt_templates.title: Form Automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill out the login form at {url} with username and password, then submit and verify success

prompt_templates.title: Performance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a performance trace on {url} and report Core Web Vitals metrics

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Step Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Open {url}, navigate to {page}, fill the search form, extract results, and save to file

output_examples.input: Open example.com and analyze the page performance

best_practices: Include the full URL and specific action requirements in your prompt
Let the agent optimize the sequence of browser operations
Request only essential output data to minimize token usage
anti_patterns: Using browser tools directly in main conversation instead of this skill
Asking for multiple screenshots of the same page unnecessarily
Combining unrelated browser tasks in a single prompt

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: Chrome DevTools MCP server must be configured. This skill delegates to the chrome-devtools-expert agent which uses MCP tools.

faq.question: What are the token limits for browser operations?
faq.answer: Token usage depends on page complexity and screenshot size. Delegation minimizes main context pollution by isolating large outputs.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: This skill activates automatically when browser operations are detected. It coordinates with chrome-devtools-expert agent internally.

faq.question: Is my browsing data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: All browser operations execute locally via Chrome DevTools. Screenshots and data stay on your machine unless you explicitly request saves.

faq.question: Why is my browser automation failing?
faq.answer: Check that Chrome DevTools MCP is running, the URL is accessible, and the page elements exist at the expected selectors.

faq.question: How is this different from using MCP tools directly?
faq.answer: Direct MCP usage pollutes main conversation with snapshots. This skill delegates to isolate large outputs and optimize token usage.
